page.title: 12Village and College Customs.
page.content: { Ampleforth Sword Dance}:- Long sword dances originated in pre-Christian rituals. 60 years ago Cecil Sharpe researched and recorded the Ampleforth dance. A monk from Ampleforth revived the dance with a team of 6 college boys in the 1950's. Replica swords were made from one found in Coxwold which had survived form an earlier performance. The dance is still performed by long sword teams who visit local villages. { Gormire Day}:-A tradition dating back to the earliest days of the school's existence. It was compulsory for the whole school to walk to Gormire Lake, thus allowing some eccentricities in the forms of transport employed. More recently the day has been revived on a voluntary basis to provide an oppor- tunity for boys and staff to carry on the tradition on a social basis.
